column4: kim_Da_Nite  the version of Virtualbox from the repo or Software Centre is the open source verison which lacks USB support,  go to the website if wanting the one that has it, that's also closed source
now if I try to delet vboxusers group and uninstall VirtualBox to do a new installation
ok
in 9.04  Virtualbox  non OSE version needed  setting up with a command or two, for the USB support
does that clear all files related to the old installation of VBox ?
I assume this is probably also the case with 9.10
you could do sudo purge packagename   to remove  virtualbox and config files,  however  the hidden .virtualbox folder in Home will probably stil be there
or use synaptic and remove the program with config files as well
I prefer apt-get
have you got vm's on there that you want to keep?
ZykoticK9 I have to keep just one vhd
copy/move it some where else, and you can delete .virtaulbox
or just keep that
you just want USB set up
This webpage should be updated for Karmic really, but here you go https://help.ubuntu.com/community/VirtualBox/USB
thx just 8min time of downloading the newest VBox version and I'll try
those instructions are for 9.04, but I assume they will be ok on 9.10 as well
You could also try Googleing for Karmic instructions
You are on 9.10/Karmic yes?
yes
